sect1.title: Install &sippi;
sect1.para: The latest stable version (v &sippi-version;) of &sippi; can be downloaded from http://sippi.sourceforge.net as SIPPI.zip. This version includes &mgstat;, SNESIM, VISIM and &mps;.
Unpack ZIPPI.zip somewhere, for example to 'c:\Users\tmh\SIPPI'. Then setup the Matlab path to point to the appropriate SIPPI directories by typing:
For use on Windows or Mac, no other setup should be needed.
For use on Linux/Unix some standolone programs will probably need to be recompiled (see below).

sect2.title: Install SIPPI manually from github
sect2.para:
The current development version of SIPPI (less stable and documented) is hosted on github. SIPPI also makes makes use of &mgstat;
These projects can be downloaded using git:
cd INSTALL_DIR git clone https://github.com/cultpenguin/sippi.git SIPPI git clone https://github.com/cultpenguin/mgstat.git mGstat
Then add a path to both SIPPI, mGstat and MPS in Matlab using
>> addpath INSTALL_DIR/mGstat >> addpath INSTALL_DIR/SIPPI >> sippi_set_path

sect3.title: Manual compilation
sect3.para: The &mgstat; toolbox make use MPS, SNESIM and VISIM (which can be used from &sippi;). Pre-compiled binaries are available for windows, but for other platforms one may need to manually compile both programs.
These programs are needed to make use of the MPS, VISIM and SNESIM type a priori models (and can hence be ignored if not used).
The source code for VISIM is located in mGstat/visim/visim_src. The compiled program should be placed in mGstat/bin and called visim.
The source code for SNESIM is available from github. The compiled program should be placed in mGstat/bin and called snesim.

The source code for &mps; is available from github. To dowload and compile &mps; use for example
cd INSTALL_DIR git clone https://github.com/cultpenguin/mps.git MPS cd MPS make all
Matlabs path should be updated to include INSTALL_DIR/MPS/matlab.

sect2.title: SGeMS (optional)
sect2.para: To make use of the SISIM and SNESIM_STD type prior models, SGeMS needs to be available.
Currently only SGeMS version 2.1 (download) for Windows is supported by &sippi;
Support for SGeMS will be discontinued after relevase v1.5, as the &mps; library will be used instead.
